name: Datetime
description: Contains methods for the Datetime primitive data type.

adddays(integer).name: addDays
adddays(integer).description: Adds the specified number of days to a Datetime.

addhours(integer).name: addHours
addhours(integer).description: Adds the specified number of hours to a Datetime.

addminutes(integer).name: addMinutes
addminutes(integer).description: Adds the specified number of minutes to a Datetime.

addmonths(integer).name: addMonths
addmonths(integer).description: Adds the specified number of months to a Datetime.

addseconds(integer).name: addSeconds
addseconds(integer).description: Adds the specified number of seconds to a Datetime.

addyears(integer).name: addYears
addyears(integer).description: Adds the specified number of years to a Datetime.

date().name: date
date().description: Returns the Date component of a Datetime in the local time zone of the context user.

dategmt().name: dateGMT
dategmt().description: Return the Date component of a Datetime in the GMT time zone.

day().name: day
day().description: Returns the day-of-month component of a Datetime in the local time zone of the context user.

daygmt().name: dayGmt
daygmt().description: Returns the day-of-month component of a Datetime in the GMT time zone.

dayofyear().name: dayOfYear
dayofyear().description: Returns the day-of-year component of a Datetime in the local time zone of the context user.

dayofyeargmt().name: dayOfYearGmt
dayofyeargmt().description: Returns the day-of-year component of a Datetime in the GMT time zone.

format().name: format
format().description: Converts the date to the local time zone and returns the converted date as a formatted string using the locale of the context user. If the time zone cannot be determined, GMT is used.

format(string).name: format
format(string).description: Converts the date to the local time zone and returns the converted date as a string using the supplied Java simple date format. If the time zone cannot be determined, GMT is used.

format(string,string).name: format
format(string,string).signature: public String format(String dateFormatString, String timezone)
format(string,string).description: Converts the date to the specified time zone and returns the converted date as a string using the supplied Java simple date format. If the supplied time zone is not in the correct format, GMT is used.

formatgmt(string).name: formatGmt
formatgmt(string).description: Returns a Datetime as a string using the supplied Java simple date format and the GMT time zone.

formatlong().name: formatLong
formatlong().description: Converts the date to the local time zone and returns the converted date in long date format.

gettime().name: getTime
gettime().description: Returns the number of milliseconds since January 1, 1970, 00:00:00 GMT represented by this DateTime object.

hour().name: hour
hour().description: Returns the hour component of a Datetime in the local time zone of the context user.

hourgmt().name: hourGmt
hourgmt().description: Returns the hour component of a Datetime in the GMT time zone.

issameday(datetime).name: isSameDay
issameday(datetime).description: Returns true if the Datetime that called the method is the same as the specified Datetime in the local time zone of the context user.

millisecond().name: millisecond
millisecond().description: Return the millisecond component of a Datetime in the local time zone of the context user.

millisecondgmt().name: millisecondGmt
millisecondgmt().description: Return the millisecond component of a Datetime in the GMT time zone.

minute().name: minute
minute().description: Returns the minute component of a Datetime in the local time zone of the context user.

minutegmt().name: minuteGmt
minutegmt().description: Returns the minute component of a Datetime in the GMT time zone.

month().name: month
month().description: Returns the month component of a Datetime in the local time zone of the context user (1=Jan).

monthgmt().name: monthGmt
monthgmt().description: Returns the month component of a Datetime in the GMT time zone (1=Jan).

newinstance(long).name: newInstance
newinstance(long).description: Constructs a Datetime and initializes it to represent the specified number of milliseconds since January 1, 1970, 00:00:00 GMT.

newinstance(date,time).name: newInstance
newinstance(date,time).signature: public static Datetime newInstance(Date date, Time time)
newinstance(date,time).description: Constructs a DateTime from the specified date and time in the local time zone.

newinstance(integer,integer,integer).name: newInstance
newinstance(integer,integer,integer).signature: public static Datetime newInstance(Integer year, Integer month, Integer day)
newinstance(integer,integer,integer).description: Constructs a Datetime from Integer representations of the specified year, month (1=Jan), and day at midnight in the local time zone.

newinstance(integer,integer,integer,inte.name: newInstance
newinstance(integer,integer,integer,inte.signature: public static Datetime newInstance(Integer year, Integer month, Integer day, Integer hour, Integer minute, Integer second)
newinstance(integer,integer,integer,inte.description: Constructs a Datetime from Integer representations of the specified year, month (1=Jan), day, hour, minute, and second in the local time zone.

newinstancegmt(date,time).name: newInstanceGmt
newinstancegmt(date,time).signature: public static Datetime newInstanceGmt(Date date, Time time)
newinstancegmt(date,time).description: Constructs a DateTime from the specified date and time in the GMT time zone.

newinstancegmt(integer,integer,integer).name: newInstanceGmt
newinstancegmt(integer,integer,integer).signature: public static Datetime newInstanceGmt(Integer year, Integer month, Integer date)
newinstancegmt(integer,integer,integer).description: Constructs a Datetime from Integer representations of the specified year, month (1=Jan), and day at midnight in the GMT time zone

newinstancegmt(integer,integer,integer,i.name: newInstanceGmt
newinstancegmt(integer,integer,integer,i.signature: public static Datetime newInstanceGmt(Integer year, Integer month, Integer date, Integer hour, Integer minute, Integer second)
newinstancegmt(integer,integer,integer,i.description: Constructs a Datetime from Integer representations of the specified year, month (1=Jan), day, hour, minute, and second in the GMT time zone

now().name: now
now().description: Returns the current Datetime based on a GMT calendar.

parse(string).name: parse
parse(string).description: Constructs a Datetime from the given String in the local time zone and in the format of the user locale.

second().name: second
second().description: Returns the second component of a Datetime in the local time zone of the context user.

secondgmt().name: secondGmt
secondgmt().description: Returns the second component of a Datetime in the GMT time zone.

time().name: time
time().description: Returns the time component of a Datetime in the local time zone of the context user.

timegmt().name: timeGmt
timegmt().description: Returns the time component of a Datetime in the GMT time zone.

valueof(string).name: valueOf
valueof(string).description: Returns a Datetime that contains the value of the specified string.

valueof(object).name: valueOf
valueof(object).description: Converts the specified object to a Datetime. Use this method to convert a history tracking field value or an object that represents a Datetime value.

valueofgmt(string).name: valueOfGmt
valueofgmt(string).description: Returns a Datetime that contains the value of the specified String.

year().name: year
year().description: Returns the year component of a Datetime in the local time zone of the context user.

yeargmt().name: yearGmt
yeargmt().description: Returns the year component of a Datetime in the GMT time zone.
